description.narrative: The Company significantly exceeded Development Impact Indicators set for the IFC''s firts loan in 2011. The proposed new project will have significant development impact, including following: -Promotion of the formal private sector abiding by rules and regulations; -Direct and indirect employment creation in rural areas of Georgia, where the job opportunities are scarce; -Generation of additional amounts of taxes paid; -Linkage to the farmers: in 2010, the Company had 300 Georgian farmers suppliers, however, today it procures grapes from more than 1,000 farmers, which is expected to grow even further even after development of own vineyards as the Company grows fast.

wEstablished in 1962, Tbilvino (the Company or Tbilvino) is one of the largest Georgian wine-makers and exporters, concentrating exclusively on wine production and procuring grapes from more than 1,000 Georgian farmers, located in the Kakheti region of Georgia. The Proposed IFC loan will be will be utilized for: (i) development of the Companys own vineyards in the Kakheti region of Georgia; (ii) permanent working capital requirement; and (iii) additional capital expenditures (collectively the Project)

mailing-address.narrative: Mr. George Margvelashvili President JSC TBILVINOTel: +995 32 65 4400Fax: +995 32 65 4020 Email: mailto:gmargvelashvili@tbilvino.com.ge , http://www.tbilvino.ge Address: Sarajishvili Ave. #2, Tbilisi, Georgia.

name.narrative: Headquartered in Tbilisi, Tbilvino has its main operational facilities in Tbilisi, the capital city, and in Kvareli, a city located in the Kakheti region. The investment will be mostly made in the Kakheti region of Georgia, which is one of the main grape growing regions in Georgia and located 150 kilometers east of Tbilisi.

activity-description.narrative: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location.

title.narrative: Summary of Investment Information - Anticipated Impact Measurement & Monitoring (AIMM) Assessment and Main Environmental & Social Risks and Impacts of the Project
